events.originalText: The Japanese space probe Hayabusa2 (artist's impression pictured) arrived at the asteroid Ryugu to collect samples for return to Earth.
events.subtitle: Hayabusa2
events.headline: Japanese space probe Hayabusa2 arrives at asteroid Ryugu for sample collection

events.originalText: Websites of Ukrainian organizations were swamped by a massive cyberattack, blamed on Russian military hackers, using the malware Petya.
events.subtitle: 2017 Ukraine ransomware attacks
events.headline: Ukrainian organizations hit by massive cyberattack blamed on Russian military hackers

events.originalText: Ignition of corn starch caused a dust fire at a water park in New Taipei City, Taiwan, killing 12 people and injuring more than 400 others.
events.subtitle: Corn starch
events.headline: Dust fire at water park in New Taipei City, Taiwan kills 12 and injures over 400

events.originalText: Robert Mugabe was re-elected as President of Zimbabwe with an overwhelming majority after his opponent Morgan Tsvangirai withdrew, citing violence against his party's supporters.
events.subtitle: Robert Mugabe
events.headline: Robert Mugabe re-elected as President of Zimbabwe after opponent withdraws

events.originalText: As a result of an ongoing conflict between drug dealers and police in the favelas of Rio de Janeiro, a large military and civil police operation killed 19 people and injured several others.
events.subtitle: Favela
events.headline: Police operation in Rio de Janeiro favelas kills 19 and injures several

events.originalText: Members of the Japanese cult Aum Shinrikyo released sarin gas in Matsumoto, Nagano, killing eight people and injuring more than five hundred others.
events.subtitle: Aum Shinrikyo
events.headline: Aum Shinrikyo cult releases sarin gas in Matsumoto, Nagano, killing eight

events.originalText: The first identifiable case of Ebola occurred in Sudan.
events.subtitle: Ebola
events.headline: First identifiable case of Ebola occurs in Sudan

events.originalText: Hurricane Audrey made landfall near the Texas-Louisiana border, killing over 400 people, mainly in and around Cameron, Louisiana, U.S.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Audrey
events.headline: Hurricane Audrey makes landfall near Texas-Louisiana border, killing over 400

events.originalText: Jacobo Árbenz (pictured) resigned as President of Guatemala following a CIA-led coup against his administration.
events.subtitle: Jacobo Árbenz
events.headline: Jacobo Árbenz resigns as President of Guatemala following CIA-led coup

events.originalText: First Russian Revolution: The crew of the Russian battleship Potemkin began a mutiny against their officers.
events.subtitle: Russian Revolution of 1905
events.headline: Russian battleship Potemkin crew begins mutiny

events.originalText: A. E. J. Collins scored 628 runs not out, the highest recorded score in cricket until being surpassed in 2016.
events.subtitle: A. E. J. Collins
events.headline: A. E. J. Collins scores 628 runs not out in cricket

events.originalText: One day after surrendering at the Battle of Hakodate, Enomoto Takeaki turned the fort of Goryōkaku over to Japanese forces, signaling the collapse of the Republic of Ezo.
events.subtitle: Battle of Hakodate
events.headline: Enomoto Takeaki surrenders at Battle of Hakodate, signaling collapse of Republic of Ezo

events.originalText: The military phase of the Meiji Restoration in Japan was completed with an imperial victory in the Boshin War.
events.subtitle: Meiji Restoration
events.headline: Imperial victory in Boshin War completes military phase of Meiji Restoration in Japan

events.originalText: American Civil War: General Sherman's frontal assault against the Confederate Army of Tennessee failed, but did not stop the Union Army from advancing on Atlanta.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: General Sherman's assault fails at Battle of Atlanta

events.originalText: War of the Second Coalition: French forces won a victory at the Battle of Neuburg, ending Austrian control over the River Danube.
events.subtitle: War of the Second Coalition
events.headline: French forces win Battle of Neuburg, ending Austrian control over River Danube

events.originalText: War of the Austrian Succession: In the last time that a British monarch led troops in battle, Allied forces commanded by George II (depicted) defeated the French army at Dettingen, Bavaria.
events.subtitle: War of the Austrian Succession
events.headline: Allied forces defeat French army at Dettingen, Bavaria

events.originalText: Queen Elizabeth I issued a royal charter establishing Jesus College, the first Protestant college at the University of Oxford.
events.subtitle: Elizabeth I
events.headline: Queen Elizabeth I establishes Jesus College at University of Oxford

events.originalText: Pope Agatho, later venerated as a saint in both the Catholic and Eastern Orthodox churches, began his pontificate.
events.subtitle: Pope Agatho
events.headline: Pope Agatho begins pontificate
